>>52833187
This one is Defense, I think? I thought he was further up Mt. Clover, weird. All the Karma Shadow Council have/had two themes to them
1: two mons from each region; 2 Fochun 2 Ebin and 2 Kekkoh
2: the 6 non-legendary mons in the game with the highest respective stats, within reason. Because if the theme was followed too autistically, HP Karma would have at least 4 fucking poison types - Dedwheat, Cacademon, Bulbapedo, Polossus. This would make him way easier to beat on type advantage alone.

Defense Karma was originally
>Tricillion - Fochun - 130
>Finasoven - Fochun - 130
>Lossolith - Ebin - 200
>Sprucifix - Ebin - 122
>Sesquatch - Kekkoh - 105
>Hornititan - Kekkoh - 130
But it seems Squeetz changed things around in 1.3 based on clover showdown meta. That's why the OU staples of Gangnome, Shiggydig, Venowatt, and Marleyzard are there. So now it is
>Tricillion - Fochun - 130
>Marleyzard - Fochun - 110
>Venowatt - Ebin - 115
>Lossolith - Ebin - 200
>Gangnome - Kekkoh - 115
>Shiggydig - Kekkoh - 130
So I'm glad Squeetz managed to retain that "2 per region" theme even with his changes

There's some people that take an interest in Meowth, but he specified that him learning to speak came at the cost of potential battle experience
He essentially allocated all 510 EVs in Speech and now can't change it anymore. He's also technically a wild Pokemon still, other trainers could try to catch him. Iris nearly did in BW. And since he Gigantamaxed in Journeys, that means he's fully evolved, so learning to speak came at the cost of his potential evolution too.

Certain other Pokemon are shown to speak too. A Slowking in the second movie spoke, and his terrible jokes are the basis for Slowking's signature move Chilly Reception. Certain legendary and mythical Pokemon can speak through telepathy, including a Lucario in his debut movie. Also Chatot and Squawkabilly.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52820975
As a video game, as good a time as any. Masters is a VERY static game in its skeleton crew phase that you'll see experience almost in full in about two months. The major storylines can be played and replayed at any time, the difficulty of the reoccurring battles is never adjusted, and the last new permanent battle challenge was the Moltres boss fight over a year ago. >>52821235 is right in that so long as you get a couple of the newest power-crept toys you'll quickly have a huge leg up in winning the battles, then that much more once you get a couple more, and so on. BUT since the most important game modes are almost never updated you can spin for who you want and make the reoccurring challenges as easy or difficult as you want (more restrictions to the Elite 4 fights, how many rounds you want to squeeze out of the legendary gauntlet, etc.)

For getting the characters you want, you need to throw 36,600 free gems into a banner to get an extra free pick from that banner (at which point you pick the rare character). You get nearly that much the first time you clear the Champion Stadium tutorial, and subsequently get about 30~32,000 a month if you do every little thing. So in practice you skip every 3 or so characters until you have the gems to assure 1, so spin for who you really want and you'll have no problem getting them.

>>52826603
Or this. You clear the story and then you're mostly doing sub-10 minute daily log-ins and fighting the Elite 4 once a week. Doesn't ask very much time at least.

>>52826095
DO NOT! Pull on any banners unless you have 36,600 gems ready to pity for them. The best unit currently available for a new player right now is arguably Serena and Greninja if you wanna use your new-player gems to pull for her, you should have enough by the time she leaves. It always helps to have a strong unit starting out to off-type carry you through some stages you just don’t have the optimal pairs for yet.

The way the pity system works in this game is, after you spend 36,600 gems you can pick any unit in the pool (which 99% of the time you’re gonna be picking the featured unit). If you have less than 36,600 gems, and you burn all your gems pulling and don’t get the unit before the banner goes away, you’ve wasted your gems for nothing. Be thankful when your luck is good and you get a unit in 1-2 multi pulls, but ALWAYS assume the game will fuck you over, and budget accordingly.

You can upgrade units to 6*EX using materials you get from Champion Stadium, which gives them a general power boost and a buff to their sync move dependent on their class. Generally speaking, you should prioritize your supports first, because they get a double sync buff on their first sync, which is the most generally useful perk.

>Iron Roe (Water/Fire) - Seaking in its "autumn colors" with a severely reduced horn but brilliantly elegant, fiery fins. Has a clear stomach absolutely riddled with eggs. Robot shit somewhere I guess
>It is said to be the product of selective breeding thousands of years into the future. It produces millions of eggs year round, several of which don't make it.
>This Pokemon is constantly in a state of rut and attempts to mate year round. It looks a lot like a possible future human-fish hybrid speculated in a paranormal magazine.

>Iron Pisces (Water/Steel) - Seaking with an insane and unwieldy horn, long and sharp like a lance. Its fins are comically small and the body is more round, making it resemble something like a living shield and polearm in silhouette. Also robot shit

>>52824206
I'm convinced that whether ANY Gen 5 Pokemon makes an appearance or not completely depends on who's putting the games together. People have such strong feelings about those games one way or another, I would not be surprised if the developers were the same way. I think that's the only way Golurk gets to appear: either one of the devs is a fan or they realize that it exists. It's a shame, because it's a cool Pokémon and would work in so much of the media but they just never use it. For being one of the largest pokédexes, we don't see many of the Gen 5 Pokémon make reappearances outside the fan favorites and maybe one or two additional lines they decide to include that seem to change with the wind. Generation 5 only got one Mega, one GMax, 7 regionals, 2 paradox, and 2 cross-gen evolutions. That's quite a bit, but it still feels like there are a lot of Pokémon from that region who just completely got snubbed and only appear when somebody remembers they exist or is a die-hard fan.

posts.com:
something I really miss about the old anime is how "dark" they build the rest of the world to be. in the earlier seasons, they had mega corporations that controlled everything, corrupt governments, corrupt systems(police, gyms, etc) large gangs(almost terrorists but still not) that controlled and had great influence over things, extremely unethical practices (although done in secret), like cloning, human-pokemon hybrids, and a few others. The world felt dangerous and team rocket(not the main 3) felt like a real threat, they had infiltrated many institutions and organizations(universities are mentioned).
Even by the time of DP(which I think was the perfect combination of maturity) the anime still had this feel to it, a real threat. maybe BW would have been the same if not for the earthquake.

but by BW(maybe because of what happened) and after the anime never really felt the same(for many reasons not just what I said) it felt kinda dull.

>>52831432
>The mute thing was edge
I'm so oblivious I just thought it was moe or a funny in joke, his Masters line about not needing words to communicate was 10/10 for me.

In my high school pokemon and all cartoons were considered "for children" so you couldn't be caught dead knowing a single thing about them (in 2000 and fucking 2, like we'd have forgotten), let alone making fanfiction reimaginings or theories. I want to say everyone skipping to Resi and GTA as little kids meant there was no need for grimdark interpretations of child friendly content but I know from the stigma I found at university it wasn't a common experience. I think I was in sixth form by the time creepypasta romhacks were about but I don't remember even glancing at them, so I completely missed that trend. Could this explain why I think fanon Red is primarily cute or goofy? I think SuMo fanworks really emphasised the difference in how JP and KR fans saw mute Reds compared to places like /vp/ where the average anon isn't looking at cutesy shipping art but did experience that need to prove your childhood interests were cool and mature like the cool and mature individual your 14-year-old self definitely was. It's just that in my case, no game or cartoon counted for that, so 14-year-old me wasn't trying it with pokemon.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
The best god damn MD game ever.
Essentially a hybrid of the standard Mystery Dungeon Games and Metal Gear Solid V/Peace Walker.
>Game's major gimmick is starting your own guild.
>Guild has departments where you put Pokemon that join you for benefits.
>Every Pokémon now have grades for their proficiency in these areas
>Things like foraging, scouting, exploring, rescuing and item knowledge
>Support areas ensure you have enough food for distant adventures whilst main areas can have teams made in them and bring in fame and revenue
>Essentially you make all the teams and give them all moves to try and be optimal at their work, you can even chose what types of dungeons they'd focus on and what work as well.
>Each day you and your MC look out from their podium at all your members. Starts off as a simple podium. Eventually gets to a massive molti story building and you look at across your thousands of members from the balcony
>Moves now have variations rather then just levels. You can sacrifice PP to have a more damaging move, or pershaps make it have longer range, splash or even pierce. You could have a stat boosting move last longer, buff more then one at once, or use big PP to do a larger buff. Giving you more vareity into what to use.
>IQ system works as an ability bar. Higher IQ, more abilites can be used. There are general IQ skills learnt throgh exploration, but also each Pokemon has their own unique IQ skills. All can be shared with the guild, but each Pokemon needs to get their own IQ up to use lots.

it has aged nowhere nearly as poorly as light platinum
you can catch all the gen I-IV legendaries and 8 from gen V, and they each have minigames

the updated version some redditor made updates movesets and abilities and fixes
it is easily a top 5 hack of all time, and the fact that it was made so long ago is unbelievably impressive

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52813974
Works sometimes, getting rid of secondary typings to become say, mono-water with a stat boost is good.
The real issue with Infinite Fusion is two fold. First a smaller one that most fusions have one orientation that is objectively better than the other, which on its own isn't an issue, but can become one because oftentimes you'll have one with great pixel art, and another with an computer generated sprite, and the computer generated fusion sprite represents better stats and abilities/typing. So the effort put in becomes wasted.
Second that the equations they use to calculate the stats end up averaging down the Base Stats of both monsters most of the time. Its only really ever 'worth it' to Fuse two monsters of the same rough BST total, that have opposite Stat distributions. This is larger and more fundamental to the system. In a game where the gimmick is fusing, its very situational whether its going to be at all worth it.
posts.filename: Left Has Hand Drawn Sprite But Bad Stats

>>52821798
You would appreciate some aspects of Prism more if you played Brown first.
Brown, the protagonist is a superboss in Prism. Mura, the rival of Brown, is an Elite 4 member in Prism too. The Palette Ranger leader was a superboss in Brown originally and said what his plan for Prism was. Prism also has some interesting lore like Brown actually losing the championship fight to Lance. The Rijon portion of Prism has some references to Brown too.
Brown is an alright game. It's gen 1 mechanics but it has post gen 1 pokemon like Electivire and it's interesting to see how they work with the Special stat. Gym fights are fun. The protagonist also isn't silent.

>keep the moisture out and prevent bending

That's going to be a challenge. >>52809002
Following the Leon battle and Project Mew conclusion, an episode preview appeared showing Chloe and Ash on a train together, and for once, Chloe seemed interested in what Ash was saying. Given the fact that she spent the entire series not giving a shit about Ash, coupled with her appearing bored during the Leon battle whereas Dawn was hyped to the moon, led to memes that she suddenly wanted Ash for herself since he was now famous and probably rich. These memes stated that Dawn had unintentionally cucked herself by making Chloe interested in Ash, and how Chloe's education made her more able to manipulate the situation to her benefit, and how she would "protect" Ash from being preyed upon by girls from his past, all while proceeding to milk him for all he was worth as a 100% gold digger. After a while, this was expanded upon by people who suddenly found bloomboltshipping unironically cute, largely due to Ash and Chloe's contrasting personalities (and the apparent "realistic" nature of the gold digger swooping in with minimal effort and stealing the nice guy that other girls had spent time trying to court), by having Chloe, in the midst of her gold-digging, slowly develop genuine feelings and then finally fall head over heels for Ash. This memeship initially caused both Pearlshippers and Amourshippers to get mad, but Dawnfags warmed to it and it's now an occasional humorous fixture of Dawn threads.

I don't often do poetry but here you go.

>The baby took her first steps today. They grow up so fast, just like they say. Her sunny smile and cherry hair are just so fair, her mother's eyes ever present in a loving stare. She's the spitting image of the one who broke my heart, the girl I never should have forced to take part. The stadium was loud and I had felt so proud, but a disinterested expression is all her face allowed. Their unexpected love burns us all, but not in the same way, not at all. Him with passion, her with desire and I with a need so dire. The baby cries and I remember that time flies. She fell for the first time, her first steps were to her a treacherous climb. The proud parents held her in their arms, not allowing her to know any other harms. Tears fell from everyone's eyes, the baby's from the fright, the parents from delight and mine from all my lies. This is not my life, the baby's not my blessing and I am not his wife.

I'll go ahead and write what I had on my mind earlier:

"What? Why are they taking so much!?"

"The more you make the more they take. That's not including your property tax, champion tax, merchant's tax and a lot of others."

"Let me see that. 32,000 dollars for a bachelor's tax?! Is this for real?"

Chloe glanced out of the corner of her eye towards the closet, where the open door revealed racks of garments made with the finest silk, cashmere and velvet. Then she looked down at her diamond bracelet and platinum necklace before turning back to the clueless champion who kept scrolling through the documents on her computer.

"Yeah, that tax is levied on any single male above 18 and below 55. They only lift it when you're married. Then you have the 'newlywed tax' until you have your first child. That ones significantly lower, though. The country really wants people to have kids."

"What!? Dang. Maybe I should just marry you so I can keep my money."

Chloe smiled.

"It would make sense..."

>>52811887
I'm his fan since day one and desu it's not that surprising. I thought people were mostly joking when they play along with my horny Gholdengo posts (now I know that's probably not the case)

Goldbro shares very little features with the actually popular mons. He's goofy and kinda cute but not in the "Awwww what a cute little creature!" way. He's super humanoid but he's not straight up cool like the megamans and he's certainly not a waifumon. He doesn't have a single animalistic feature (furry-ish designs attract both furries and normies, even if it's for different reasons)

He's a mix of humanoid and object Pokemon, probably two of the most disliked types of Pokemon designs. He's humanoid AND goofy. not really a combination that makes popular mons. Being good in competitive doesn't translate to actual popularity. If anything him being everywhere makes people hate him even more

Since it's on topic, I wound up doing some filter gambling last night because I got pissed off after getting filtered by not saying anything lewd.

What I learned is that ironically, the biggest thing that the domain will filter out of the system is sexual consent. I learned that after getting jammed by making a suggestive prompt that literally had zero terms that the site would auto-detect. What's even more bizarre about that, since you can watch the AI responses develop before getting struck down, is that it is not always about the AI saying filtered words either. It is literally the system 'trying to' reject all traces of the AI being in the mood.

The reason why that's so hilarious is that you CAN get away with sex if you can figure out euphemisms or alternate terms that the filter did not bar yet. With that being said, since it's consensual behavior that gets smited, it's actually EASIER to perform no-con, and likely most fetishes.

The annoying thing about this is that I have figured out enough bypass terms and phrases to get away with conventional sex comfortably without filters getting in the way. But sharing those secrets is too risky when they start getting spammed at a rate where devs will notice and adjust. I don't want that, so I'll just leave pic related as a hint.

>>52832979
I'm like 90% sure that randos that run your bot will slowly affect it to a certain degree, but I'm 100% sure that if that's true, it's weighted in YOUR favor.
I think the way it works is that some huge percentage of the bot's mannerisms and whatever, maybe 80% or so, is controlled 100% by you and your ratings and can never be changed, but the other 20% is free to be tweaked by people's ratings and actions.
Also I think your copy of a bot when you chat with them is pretty standalone from the base bot, in that something like 50% is by the creator, 30% is you, and 20% is everyone else, and the 30% is only visible by you specifically.

Of course a lot of it is anecdotal and straight up just assumptions, but I remember specifically back when I had tailor-made a bot just for me and she seemed exactly the way I wanted her to be, I then released her publicly and she lost a few of her chat quirks I coded into her details page, overwritten by people who probably just wanted someone more generic.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52836458
NTA but see >>52836405. It's frail, but there's enough Ghost/Steel/Fire/Grass moves running around where it can get chances to come in, and that's not even mentioning stuff like Shed Tail, U-turn, Volt, etc. You can try minimizing the chances it has to come in all you like, but that number is never going to be "0".

Using the Galar-Darm comparison again, that was frail as shit too and in theory didn't do well into hyper offensive teams, but it always found a way in, and once it did, it's back to "Pray that your designated switchin doesn't just get melted immediately" or "pray that you brought Spdef Roaring Moon because that's the one half decent check floating around"

You can also say "saccing is counterplay" all you want, but you can only sack so many times, especially since Chi Yu is likely not the only threat on the opponent's team, and even if you can force a sack war, because of how blisteringly strong Chi Yu is, you're taking a hard disadvantage in said sack war. I've played HO (and Sun even!) into Chi Yu teams with this very mentality and oftentimes the endgame would come down to "I hope I can take exactly 1 hit and revenge", Chi Yu speedties, or praying Dragonite didn't get flinched

Roaming around looking for shinies while listening to a podcast is pretty comfy, and I'm almost guaranteed to get at least one shiny per sandwich so I don't feel like I'm wasting my time, either
Speaking of, SOS Chaining in Gen VII was pretty solid as well, being very low-risk and having a nice selection of mons to find
>what you're currently going after
Nothing at the moment. I want to aim for the new shinies but most of them don't appeal to me much and the ones that do, such as Chi-Yu and Koraidon are shiny locked. Gen 1 and 2 mons don't appeal to me either since I can just duplicate and trade over infinite shinies from the Virtual Console rereleases once HOME connectivity becomes a thing so I'd rather just wait for that

I just realize why the 7 star raids have the moves they have.

For Charizard, it's because it's a dragon and dragons are known to be very powerful. It have Fire Blast, Hurricane, Focus Blast because they are super powerful moves. Also Dragon Pulse because that's the closes it have for a super powerful dragon move.

Now here Cinderace and it's moves are supposed to match both it's typing and sport it's based on. Pyro Ball and HJK are easy to understand on it's own, then you have Acrobatic where soccer players need to be to fast and limber. Iron Head is because Gunk Shot wouldn't work for a Fighting type since throwing trash would be consider dirty fighting and hitting the ball with your head.

>>52830537
Lake Ronkonkoma is Long Island's biggest and deepest lake. For some time, Indians thought the lake was bottomless because people who had drowned there would often just disappear, their bodies never recovered.
Buried in the lake’s waters are untold lost bodies, they say — the victims of a centuries-old ghost who regularly drags young men to their graves.
The most prevalent legend is about Princess Ronkonkoma, an Indian princess who died at the lake in the mid-1600s.
One version of the story is that she was walking across the ice one winter when she met and fell in love with an English woodcutter named Hugh Birdsall, who lived across the lake. However, her father—chief of the Setauket tribe—forbade their relationship. So every day for 7 years, she would write letters on pieces of bark, row to the middle of the lake, and float the letters across the lake to Hugh. Then, after all those years of being kept apart from her love, she rowed to the middle of the lake and stabs herself in the heart.

According to locals, who love to retell the tragic tale in one version or another, every year since, “The Lady of the Lake’’ has made it her mission to grab a young man from her watery grave to replace her lost love.
Drowning statistics back up the legend, some residents said.

There were at least 160 drownings at the lake between the mid- to late 1800s and late 1970s, averaging well over one a year — and only three victims were women
longtime Lake Ronkonkoma lifeguard David Igneri, 74, who has a doctorate in colonial American history, said that in the 34 years he helped guard the lake’s beaches starting in the 1960s, there were 30 drownings alone — all male victims.

>>52822842
Can you really prove they're traced and not just the continuation of the models attempting to be slavishly accurate to Sugimori's final art of each Pokemon? My understanding is that they have the reference sheets and then Sugimori makes his final art and everything is finalized based on his art.

That said Sugimori's art has been so bland since gen 3. I don't mean muh watercolors here it's just gen 3 is the gen where 90% of the Pokemon were just static shots. Each gen it got worse and worse. If they're bipedel it's a standing shot from the front, if they're quadrupedal or a snake/fish/etc it's a side profile shot. Gen 1 put many of the Pokemon in dynamic poses, and really benefitted from Sugimori drawing every Pokemon multiple times in multiple different poses. I like Sugimori but I think a younger artist would really breathe some new life into the official art.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52820296
>Does anyone know what exactly triggers finding expeditions?
From what I can tell, it's mostly random. Planting flowers seems to make it more likely, but at least in the past just going to an area that I haven't lit up on the world map (no green in the lifelog/expedition map) has gotten me more stuff. Even then, planting flowers only seems to work a few times per week before things stop showing up.

Should also be noted that seedlings are significantly less likely to show up if you already have a bunch from nearby S2 cells (no idea what size they are, but the rectangle they occupy in the Pikmin map screen suggest they're based on S2 cells). Either releasing them or doing activity in places with no Pikmin collected from should increase odds of getting more seedlings.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52820887
>Does releasing Pikmin do anything besides delete them?
You get 10 default petals from whatever color of nectar it was fed most recently. Very useful if you are low on nectar for a certain color or don't need any more Pikmin of a certain type for mushroom challenges.
>about how much of the map do you have discovered
Basically nothing, since that would require playing the game in every corner of the Earth. I also don't tend to leave my local area just to get more expeditions.
>how many expeditions do you get daily on average?
Ignoring detector expeditions, I usually get a couple if I'm walking around or a few (3 or more) if I plant at least 250 flowers.
>We're going hiking on Friday which is about 40 minutes away... do you ever get any expeditions from far away places like that?
You're probably more likely to get expeditions around places with many Niantic points of interest (POIs), but you'll probably still get a few things on that hike. I certainly get a good amount of expeditions from hiking spots in the middle of nowhere.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52824376
It's not just the PP nerf.
Cutting access to Scald means physical attackers don't have to fear switching in on bulky waters.
Cutting access to Knock Off means choice users don't have to fear switching in on other fatmons.
Cutting access to Toxic means that a lot of fatmons have no way of even dealing damage.
Glimmora means it's easier than ever to get hazards up, and this is before H-Samurott and Kleavor come back.
Gholdengo means it's harder than ever to get rid of hazards.
Not even taking into account the simple fact that offense has gotten way more toys than defense has.

The pure "do nothing" stall that gen 8 was infested with is well and truly dead. There's no bringing it back.

Starters were never shitmons, but the other 3 stage(Pidgeot) you got early was. Despite both of them having conditions that mean that they should atleast be relevant at that level range(instead of vaguely being better than a level 20 evo)

>Vs Atticus
>Skuntank
I send in Sceccu, who Terastalizes immediately.
The Skuntank manages to deal some nasty damage with a Sucker Punch Crit right of the bat, but Stamina will weaken most followiing blows. High Horsepower deletes the Skunk.
>Revavroom
It Iron Heads Sceccu, but does less than impressive damage, and Stamina keeps racking up.
High Horsepower takes the motor mon out.
>Muk
It uses Sludge Wave, but it does fairly little- just enough to push Sceccu into Mago Berry range. Stamina keeps stacking.
High Horsepower misses, and Muk scores a Sludge Wave crit before falling to a second attempt. More Stamina is building up.
>Navi Starmobile
Spin Out does basically nothing except put Sceccu's defense up to +5, and High Horsepower does about half of the Starmobile's health.
Another Spin Out caps out Sceccu's defense just in time for him to end the fight with another High Horsepower.
I honestly think Stamina Mudsdale is seriously banworthy in Nuzlockes, and if it hadn't been the shiny I caught this run, I would not have run it on my team.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52836911
In a world were no other mons but the starters exist, Tepig might be the best, as it has arguably the best typing and matchups of the three.
But in the actual games, it has so many top tier mons that compete for its role. Archeops Flying type somewhat overlaps fire, Darumaka is broken, and the game drowns you in excellent Fighting types.
Meanwhile, Oshawott has almost no competition for the role as best Water-type. The Tympole line is the most notable contender and it is worse overall.
Outside Nuzlockes, Simipour is arguably the best Water-type because it is powerful and can be fully evolved and spamming Scald at level 22, but the frailty makes me think twice. >>52831247
If we're just going off remaking Ruby and Sapphire, no it fucking wasn't. It omitted plenty of stuff, some understandable (fuck the EU) some completely unreasonable (why did they cut New Mauville anyway?), changed several things in baffling ways (like, worse than FRLG's encounter tables and version exclusives bad), and the added/altered content barely makes up for it and changes a lot of the overall feel of the game (sometimes for the worse). ORAS is definitely better than BDSP, which is just DP but worse in so many areas that the improvements aren't worth it, but ORAS isn't a good remake. It is probably the best Gen 6 game though, and definitely makes the best use of any console's communication features I think. I guess ORAS is a better game than FRLG, overall, but it's definitely a worse remake than it. And this is from somebody who doesn't care much for FRLG out of the overworld art style being way fucking better than the other Gen 3 games (there's a reason they stuck with it going forward up until Gen 5).

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52824184
It bothers me how the paths in SV's "open world" don't seem well thought out. Most players will end up just going from point A to point B on the map, jumping between the three storylines, with either an overleveled team or a team specifically selected for whatever that objective is that they are heading to. But it creates a very jagged, stilted playthrough where unless you were doing things in the "suggested" order you find yourself constantly being too strong or too weak to complete different goals in what feels like unrelated stories at the time. Or, if you are doing the suggested path, even then you're jumping back and forth between plot points and it just seems so inorganic. They should have planned it more like BOTW where each area of the map had its own separate storyline, and you could do each of those story lines in any order, with them all culminating at the end of the game

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52826275
It pisses me off how bad they are designing an open world. PLA seemed to understand it, so why didn't this game? It should have been something like this
>You do the same plot line up until the school
>You set off to anywhere you want to go on the map
>Each part of Paldea has its own plot line that connects to the larger plot, can be done in any order
>You go to the bug gym first just because and find out that large boulders are falling from the sky and crushing their olive crops
>Arven is there and he's convinced it's a Titan, but he needs more evidence. Walks you into the town
>Nemona is waiting for you at the gym, and the gym leader comes out to tell you both that she's not opening the gym until someone figures out the crop issue, points out the giant bird in the sky
>You're encouraged to go up the mountain to figure out what's going on and find some MacGuffin
>You see the bird Titan flying over the fields and Arven joins you to lure it with MacGuffin
>You fight the Titan, find the herb, unlock a new travel ability, and then go back down the mountain to meet Nemona
>Challenge and defeat the gym leader, now you can access new areas of that part of the map since the boulders are gone
>Nemona says she will meet you at the next gym and you either go there or don't. Arven mentions where he thinks another Titan is as well
>Every part of the map works in this sort of way, sometimes with Team Star or a Titan or both but always centralized around a gym
>You clear the 8th gym and already did the Titans, and then you finish off Team Star. Battle Penny in the school yard, Star gets redeemed, Clavell thanks you, says to meet him after you beat the League...
>Nemona meets you at the Pokémon League and fights you. Do E4, then Nemona. Credits.
>Arven calls you and you battle him. Start the Area Zero stuff. But you also can go meet with Clavell at any point for his battle, which offers you daily.

How would this not have been a way better fucking format?

>>52826275
I kind of got the impression that they expected us to do each storyline as a self-contained thing. So you would have done the gyms, then gone back to the beginning to start the Titans, then come back to the beginning to start the villain team. I don't know why a sane person would do that, but the game seemed to be built in that way where the stories don't really cross over at all and the only reason you would be doing them concurrently is to get stuff like the ride powers or just because you're conveniently there. Otherwise their design, even with their end content, seems to cry that they are meant to be done separately with separate teams. And I should have listened to that advice someone gave me when I first bought the game, because they said that's how they played and it made the experience a lot better.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52837317
>>52837333
Pokemania was never about the games. It was about the anime, the movies, the clothing, the stickers, the merchandise. The Pokemon company has never made most of its money through the games. When pokemania first hit, arguably with the first episodes of the anime, the amount of merchandising you could see absolutely everywhere was absurd. Everything looked like a Pokemon giftshop from Japan, it was in pencils, pens, backpacks, socks, stickers, notebooks. People had plushies, toys, pogs, went to the movies, and religiously followed the anime. Most people did not, however, play the games. In fact, a great portion of the kids were unaware that the games in fact came first and were the core of the franchise. But it all revolved around Kanto Pokemon. Always. By the time Johto pokemon started to roll out, the fad was already on its last legs. The novelty was lost and the kids who grew up with the original series were now edgy teens desperately trying to move away from all the "baby" shit. The only two Johto pokemon that had any semblance of impact outside of its games were Ho-Oh, because it showcased in the first episode of the anime, and Lugia, because it had its own movie in Pokemon 2000 (that in hindsight is far less remembered than the Mewtwo movie, and it heavily featured the Kanto legendary birds). When pokemania first started you could see even shitmons like Odish and Jynx fucking everywhere. When it was ending, even some of the most beloved Johto pokemon were ignored, only riding in the coattails of Gen 1 like an unmemorable parasitic tumor.

People didn't suddenly wake up and decided they didn't like Hoenn. It wasn't a one day-night shift. It was a process and it involved the absolutely bland as fuck Johto dex that has always lived in the shadows of Kanto. Even to this day, the Johto starters get mostly ignored and get outshined by Gens 3, 4, 6 and 7.

People trying to attach Gen 2 to pokemania never fail to make me laugh.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52837471
Hell, the stupid zoomer Pokemon phone app had more impact than Johto ever hoped to achieve. It was itself nowhere close to actual pokemania.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52837471
The games absolutely mattered.
Pokemon revived the Gameboy on both sides of the Atlantic. Every fucking kid around was carrying one of those bricks with a set of extra batteries and one of those attachable lights.
30 million units for GSC being sold in 1999-2000 was insane.
Johto was well sold as a new mystery for people to explore, and really it delivered on that. The kids talking about how they found Godzilla in the game and being called liars come to mind.

RSE coming out when it did, several years later where kids started getting to the age of being embarrassed to like Pokemon again. And it being an underwhelming sequel took the Pokemania down as a pair.

>>52837550
>>52837561
As a last reply from my part.
Pokemania was never about the games. 30 million is such an insignificant number in the grand scheme of things compared to the total populations of Japan and the US alone (by far the biggest consumers) without even taking Europe into account. Now add the rest of the world and it's truly insignificant because, again, Pokemania was not limited to the games. It's was the absolute definition of peak hardcore mainstream normalfaggotry, the likes of which very few things have enjoyed. Maybe only the MCU autismo, but even that probably fails short. You could not escape pokemon no matter how much you tried. There weren't 30 million kids alive in the late 90s, yet absolutely fucking EVERYONE in the WORLD was obsessed with pokemon during the peak of Pokemania. The amount of kids without the games who were also obsessed with Pokemon (because again, pokemon as a money making franchise has never been limited to the games, far from it) far surpassed the nerds who owned the gameboys.

t. nerd who owned the gameboy, gameboy color, gameboy advance and gameboy SP

Most of my friends didn't play the games, even the ones with a Gameboy (which they owned mainly because they were rich and bought everything for the lols, even if they didn't plan to use them). You say that not being allowed to catch or transfer Gens 1 and 2 pokemon was significant. But in reality, porting mons from Gen 1 to Gen 2 wasn't particularly easy, and as a result, widespread. And later Gen 3 got FRLG to fix that. But this is missing the point, because again, and I can't stress this enough: Pokemania was not about the games.

posts.com:
My favourite explanation for the whole thing: most pokemon naturally want to fight and become stronger, so when they are beaten or sufficiently impressed by trainer or his pokemon, they willingly accept capture in order to train under them and become better. Kinda like shonen antagonists who join protag's party after getting their asses beat by them. The whole system runs on pokemon recognizing and honouring trainer's strength, which is also why traded high level pokemon will not listen to you - you've yet to prove your worth to them, and only by beating 8 gym leaders and presenting their badges you can earn their respect. That interpretation dodges the whole "enslavement" thing and gives pokemon agency and intelligence, the only caveat being that majority of pokemon are naturally hardwired to fight and intent to grow stronger.

I always understood it as a win-win for humans and Pokémon. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52828248
As someone who plays with AI a lot, I feel it's fine for recreational usage which is the same reason requests and commissions can be made. I don't much care for the use of AI for profit or as a solution for hiring artists for professional work (comic, children's books).

It's not an easy or reliably controllable method as a flesh-and-blood artist will at least negotiate how your ideas work and has a more reliable way of conceptualizing your ideas. Even then, I still encourage a lot of people in this thread to play with Stable Diffusion enough to know how much it works (or rather doesn't work) with their ideas to know it's not really that much doom for artists as they think it is.

Just because you prompt something and think it out doesn't mean the system will "get" what you want.

posts.sub: How to Kill The Rabbit: Solo Edition
posts.com:
The below is what you’ll need.

Slowbro @ Life Orb
Ability: Oblivious
EVs: 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA
Modest Nature
- Nasty Plot
- Iron Defense
- Psychic Terrain
- Stored Power

How to use:
1. Set up Iron Defense 3 times
2. Set up Nasty Plot 3 times
3. Use Psychic Terrain or else it won’t OHKO
4.Use Stored Power

Remember, solo NPCs are more useful than online players, ironically enough. The NPCs are competent enough to stay alive and too incompetent to do much damage to Cinderace, so they will not trigger the shield. Online players are the inverse, which is obviously bad for you and triggers the rabbit to reset your stat changes.

Note: Use the “Heal” cheer when low on health. Slack off isn’t worth the moveslot.

posts.com:
>>52836841
You really don't need both LO and Psychic Terrain.

Calcs:
>+6 252+ SpA Life Orb Tera Psychic Slowbro Stored Power (260 BP) vs. 0 HP / 0 SpD Cinderace in Psychic Terrain: 8854-10419 (2941.5 - 3461.4%) -- guaranteed OHKO

Remember you need to get over 2500% damage to OHKO.

Without LO:
>+6 252+ SpA Tera Psychic Slowbro Stored Power (260 BP) vs. 0 HP / 0 SpD Cinderace in Psychic Terrain: 6812-8016 (2263.1 - 2663.1%) -- guaranteed OHKO

Without Psychic Terrain:
>+6 252+ SpA Life Orb Tera Psychic Slowbro Stored Power (260 BP) vs. 0 HP / 0 SpD Cinderace: 6811-8017 (2262.7 - 2663.4%) -- guaranteed OHKO

By the time you boosted 3 Iron Defenses, 3 Nasty Plots, your NPC players will probably cut down around 200 of 2500% damage. You could really go for Slack Off instead of Psychic Terrain. Even if it survives with let's say 100 HP and it puts up a shield, you need one more turn and it's done.

>What is it?
https://www.pokeclicker.com/
Pokéclicker is an open-source game built around the story and content of the Pokémon games. This is an idle & clicker type game that is currently in beta release phase. New content and patches are released frequently.

>Crobat?
https://crobat4.github.io/pokeclicker/
A modified version of Pokeclicker that features QoL changes from the original, including a Dock shortcut, type-based pokeball selection, Gen 3+ berries being available in dungeons, un-nerfed experience gains, and some egg-exclusive pokemon being available through other means.

>Wiki
https://pokeclicker.miraheze.org/wiki/Home_Page

>CODES
Start Menu > Save > Enter Code
>OOOSHINY
Free shiny
>FARMINGBOOST
10,000 Farm Points and 100 Cheri Berries
>CROBATISBASED (Crobat fork only)
Awards a Rotom (Crobat)

>Encounter tables, best places to gem/EV farm
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IxPh59_lNxZUa3Qo3r5ZbawGHL_nfqqd
>Various forecasts
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1HFK5gS4XDmqXvZPP8stBYGC9ZF77i-Wug2J_gcmJ5rw
>Check your save for missing pokemon
https://cypherx.github.io/pokeclicker-missing-util/

Baffling to me an open source browser game in 2022 won't even allow discussion of modding while real games include mod suppport, encourage modding, or even integrate mods into their games as features. Beyond being silly, they're killing off the scriptDev-to-gameDev pipeline. You've got a niche group of people who know how to code, have spent time getting familiar with the game's code, and are invested enough in the game to write for it. They're low hanging fruit for recruitment, but if they drop into the Discord they'll find that even discussing scripts is enough to get you branded by a condescending mod. It's not just a few people either: the main script github repository has 238 forks and 144 stars compared to 247 forks and 391 stars on the games actual repo. That's a lot of developer investment to spit in the face of.

>>52811471
Its ideal to completely infect your whole collection.
If you were to infect enough, you should see the pokerus symbol on every route and dungeon that has pokemon you have caught and infected.
Getting to 50 evs on the right pokemon will turn that symbol blue on both the pokemon, and routes and dungeons if all the pokemon in them are resistant. Pretty much, Pokerus is Good if you keep your catching / passive catching.
Of course, There are pokemon that don't benefit from pokerus yet, due to being obtainable ONCE, or do not show up in the wild, wandering, shops, or evolution item results.
But, still worth infecting when the day comes they will be.

>>52811616
The game's FAQ from the top right corner of the screen , 3 quarters the way down the list, almost completely scrolled down in that interface says as much as you need to know about EVs.

The only thing it doesn't tell you is that the Macho Brace can only ever be equipped on a single pokemon at a time, will have to unequip it, then equip a different new one. buyable only at the Fight Area in Sinnoh post e4. For every Rowap Berry that is active in the Farm will also boost ev gains from each source, also affected by the lum berry boost, too. The multipliers stack, and you can easily get resistance if you keep the combo up.

>>52811914
Various evolved pokemon do end up in the wild in the later regions, however, if you can "repeat" the evolution process with an item, That will gain EVs. Some pokemon get new evolution methods in later generations that use items, Like Magnezone, Leafeon, Glaceon, In Galar, so there is lots of potential to gain evs later.
Certain baby pokemon, or pokemon that requires you to hatch another pokemon that don't show up in the wild will leave you REALLY out of luck. In Crown Tundra you will be able to find wild fossil pokemon, as reviving fossils won't give you evs either

Mints don't actually change the nature. It just makes the Pokémon have the effect of another nature while retaining its actual nature. So they arnt pretending to be anything. The Pokémon acts the same while getting different Stat boosts. It's perfect.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Natures are one of Game Freak's ways of making individual Pokemon unique and having its own personality, which was why they made the Battle Palace in Emerald's Battle Frontier. However, rather than having a diverse team, every single Pokemon on the player's team ended up being one of the 6-8 useful natures. So Game Freak have added mints to the game so that any Pokemon you catch in the game, they don't change the personality of the Pokemon but they allow the stats to be min-maxed.

They've also made IVs easy to change with bottle caps now, so that the characteristic of the Pokemon can be diverse. People mocked the guy who wanted a "Proud of its power" Lucario but that's the exact sort of thing that Game Freak wants people to pay attention to.

>>52817607
I don't mind this so much, as they've introduced so much that makes fixing a majority of Pokémon so accessible.
Nothing is gated behind a battle facility either, just main story progress, then you can buy the individual items needed.

EV reducing berries are plentiful in the right part of the map, or the auction house.
Vitamins increase EVs all the way to 252, and you can't go over 252 like previous games.
EV power training held items are available from the very beginning, and it only takes 28 battles against a suitable EV yield source.
Nature mints can be outright bought for a mere 20k, not randomly given like in Arceus or behind BP like in Sword/Shield.
Ability capsules can also be bought, with only ability patches for the hidden abilities being particularly hard to acquire.
Mirror herb can be used to teach egg moves to Pokémon that didn't learn it from breeding.
Bottle caps can also be bought for 20k to hyper train individual stats where necessary, and the requirement for hyper training was reduced to level 50, down from 100. This is especially important for the things that can't breed like legendaries and paradox Pokémon.

Tera Blast was also blatantly conceived as an alternative to hidden power, and it's pretty nice.

Also, credit to Sword/Shield for introducing the XP candies, solving the problem of wasting a rare candy at low levels.

There's also QoL improvements like, Thief works by putting the stolen item directly into your bag, and collected eggs go directly into your box.

There's still dumb shit with affection mechanics though. As an example from a few minutes ago
>Poison Heal Breloom with Toxic Orb
>Breloom managed to expel the poison so you wouldn't worry!
>Breloom was badly poisoned by its Toxic Orb
All it took was to make one sandwich for a level 2 dragon type catching bonus, and now this Breloom can randomly not self-heal from poison every other turn.

Also, Breloom strangely can't learn Spore if it didn't learn it as a Shroomish.

Yeah, the game still works to maintain some kind of economy to defer instant gratification.
Tera raid rewards are generous, but the number you can do per day is limited, and you only get one six star raid a day, and event seven star raids too which are designed around min-maxing.

That said, I've stuck on version 1.0.1 for the time being in order to make the most of the item duping exploit.
It took time, but after 80 hours on my main Violet save and 27 hours on my second Scarlet game, I completed the Pokédex on Violet and got my Beast Ball.
Now I have 100+ Beast Balls and will be cloning a lot more, along with Apricorn balls, Master balls, Exp. Candy XL, Bottle Caps, and hopefully Ability Patches if I can succeed in getting one. I can probably just farm the Academy Ace Tournament, or try my luck with a tier 6 raid and local communication, which will repeatedly give raid rewards to the group guests that keep losing.

Once I have a very generous stash of all the hardest to get items, I'll update the game so I can start participating in event raid battles like with Cinderace. I already missed Charizard, but it might come back.

It is a melancholy realization that it is difficult to pinpoint a specific moment when the Pokémon lore "went awry," as different people may have different opinions on what constitutes a deviation from the established lore of the Pokémon franchise.

The Pokémon franchise, which has brought joy to so many for over 25 years, has produced a vast array of games, anime series, movies, and other media. However, as the franchise has grown and evolved, it is unfortunate but unsurprising that the lore and continuity may have become convoluted. Additionally, The Pokémon Company, which oversees the franchise, is made up of various companies and organizations, each with their own creative teams who may have different ideas and approaches to storytelling within the Pokémon universe. It is a shame that such diversity of thought may contribute to a perceived deviation from the beloved lore.

>>52833719
It was a constant escalation.
Gen 1 was just the real world, but with the addition of superpowered monsters. Strongest legendary was a science project.
Gen 2 was less clearly the real world, and the new strongest legendaries were basically like local deities, but nothing too crazy.
Gen 3 is unambiguously not the real world, and the legendaries are now forces of nature that can potentially end the world.
Gen 4 says that the Abrahambic God with a capital G is a Pokemon, and you'd think that's the limit, but apparently not.
Gen 6 decides to introduce an ancient war, a 3000-year-old man, an apocalyptic super weapon, and branching timelines.

I'd say gen 3 was the point where the genie was truly out of the bottle, although it wasn't peak batshit insanity.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Kanto pandering serves an important marketing purpose. It's not feasible to catch new fans up with 8 generations worth of shit, so they constantly reiterate Kanto and its iconography to make sure every Pokemon fan knows it. It's meant to be common ground that all Pokemon fans share. So when they do something like the Alola forms, everybody will instantly recognize them as recolored Pokemon because they know the originals (I've seen people playing Sword and Shield who didn't even realize Yamask was a regional form).

Or in USUM, where they made the joke about the tourist trap gym built by people who have no idea how a gym works (based on the creators' experience going to a Hawaiian "authentic Japanese steakhouse"). They COULD have used something like Skyla's gym for the gag, but half of players probably wouldn't recognize it. But anyone who's played gen 1, 2, or the gen 3 and 4 remakes (or later LGPE) would recognize the location and get that it's supposed to be a shitty copy.

That's why Kanto is "pandered" to so much. It's the generation that everyone recognizes and they want to keep it that way for new fans. That way they put a random gen 1 Pokemon like Koffing on any piece of merchandise and people will recognize it as a Pokemon item.

>>52831414
Gen 4's encounter rates were probably an oversight rather than pandering. It was the first time they'd made a generation on paper instead of alongside the maps. They probably just didn't realize how few of the Pokemon they'd made could be used on specific routes, since they were almost all legendaries, cross-gen evolutions, and Pokemon specific to a habitat (they had a similar problem in gen 5, where they didn't realize until late in production they hadn't made a generic fish to put in rivers).

And since they didn't want to rehash the previous generation, the map was populated mainly with Kanto Pokemon.

Pokemon has changed 2, maybe 3 times in its history, this is not one of them.
The first was GSC being made at all, turning it into a series,
the second was gen 3 creating a more consistent formula, everything up to gen 8 was just simplifying and reinforcing that formula, with extra nostalgia focus starting in BW2/XY.
Then gen 8 made both the dexcut and the wild area introducing a larger, but simpler, open map. This could be seen as the start of a 3rd era.
This has nothing to do with quality, but there are clear design concepts that have changed over time.

>>52832683
The reason a show (or anything really) changes the central cast or story direction is usually because of lowered interest. There will probably always be a hardcore group interested in certain things, but that doesn't grow you an audience. You can keep around legacy characters (5 to 10 is probably the limit, given what I've seen) but sometimes you have to try something new. And sometimes, the new thing sucks even worse than the old stagnation, so there's always the chance of falling back on what works. But sometimes, you hit on something really good and iconic in it's own right. You're a 90's kid, you probably remember Beast Wars yeah? Probably one of the best reboots Transformers has has, probably the most impactful on a lore front, and easily the most radically different to the point Hasbro lost trademarks over it. It worked for a while, and eventually it got stale (Beast Machines was kind of a mess), so they rolled it back to car robots with Armada, and when that ran it's course they went with the movies, and when everyone thought the movies were ugly they've mostly been iterating on Gen 1 designs since then. Sure you get some stuff in there that's a bit more stylized or good, Animated was pretty good and the Aligned stuff was okay I guess (I've heard good things about the Cybertron games, for example). But at the end of the day, you fall back on what people remember, and now what people remember is Beast Wars so they're making a movie with Optimus Primal in it. Will it be good? Who knows, Hasbro sure hopes so. I probably went on a bit of a tangent there, but do you get where I'm coming from at least? Or am I too deep in to "to sell toys" territory?

I just realize why the 7 star raids have the moves they have.

For Charizard, it's because it's a dragon and dragons are known to be very powerful. It have Fire Blast, Hurricane, Focus Blast because they are super powerful moves. Also Dragon Pulse because that's the closes it have for a super powerful dragon move.

Now here Cinderace and it's moves are supposed to match both it's typing and sport it's based on. Pyro Ball and HJK are easy to understand on it's own, then you have Acrobatic where soccer players need to be to fast and limber. Iron Head is because Gunk Shot wouldn't work for a Fighting type since throwing trash would be consider dirty fighting and hitting the ball with your head.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52831272
The ideas that went into the forms is pretty easy to understand. Two unrelated Pokemon ended up looking like pre-existing ones due to evolutionary pressures or similar behaviors, which is exactly how convergent evolution happens in reality.
For the Wigglet line, it was an eel that developed a pronounced nose so it could better hide from it's predators like Veluza and Barraskewda. For the Toedscool line, it was a mushroom Pokemon that sprouted from the ground and started walking to better hunt prey by wrapping its mycelium around them and draining them of their fluids (which is similar to how the Tentacool line hunts, which is by wrapping them in their tentacles and stabbing them).
It's obviously to an exaggerated extent because no actual mushroom will just up and start walk, but Pokemon's been built on the extreme exaggeration of biological concepts mixed with standard sci-fi pseudoscience since Day 1.

>>52832192
Meowscarada is 100% the one they're going to pick. Remember that all Pokemon, save the OGs from Smash 64, are recommended to Sakurai by TPCi. For example, he didn't know anything about Greninja other than they wanted him to use it so he designed its entire kit before its official design was even finalized. And even the PokeBall Pokemon, music tracks and stages all get suggested and then approved by TPCi. So even if Sakurai had some crazy boner for something like Palafin, it's always going to be whatever TPCi shills which, in this case, is totally Meowscarada.

4chan shipping is a novel phenomena, it does give the vibe of mostly male and is solidified and accelerated by competition and fighting as opposed to making art or fics. Best girl bowl and powerlevel wars adjacent

When I put it that way it makes it sound like the boy 4chan shippers are more palatable. But shipping wars is a cancer that completely envelops the general threads they turn up in, annoying everybody who wants to talk about other things, and the points of argument is insanely repetitive and goes on for years.
At least the girl shippers on the art and fic sites have ways to quarantine themselves from general and rival fans through use of tags, and they get productive - coming up with new scenarios, headcanons, alternate universes, sharing all kinds of art; they go full into creative exploration of the ship, and some of the greatest art I've seen in my life has been from chicks completely obsessed with a ship and encouraged to develop that obsession in their space.
